Q5.1: My mentor offers scientific knowledge, strong leadership and an accepting culture.

My faculty mentor is great to work with. He is direct, sets his expectations, and is always available when needed. He respects me as both a student and a professional and truly wants me to succeed and find my passions. He explains techniques and methods in a clear concise manner. He goes out of his way to ensure students feel welcomed, are asking questions, and learning what they both need and want to learn. He can be a bit pessimist at times, especially when talking about the peer review process, grad school, and overall science. However, he is a realist and I appreciate his honesty concerning those things.
My faculty mentor has been nothing but amazing, he is always patient and helpful. This has been a great experience.

The experience I have had working with my faculty mentor has been amazing! Right from when I first met them I could tell they had a lot of passion for what they do and that is very important to me. They are very patient with me and excited to teach me all about the world of science which in turn makes me excited to learn more. They also listen to me and my concerns and makes sure to help me really understand what I am doing and why it is important. This has been a wonderful opportunity and I hope to keep in touch with my mentor in the years to come!

It has been very eye opening to all the work and preparations that go into doing research. MY mentor has done a great job at slowly easing me into all of it and has also done a great job of explaining what I don't understand.

My faculty mentor is very supportive and available whenever we need him. He is also dedicated to helping us understand the big picture of the lab's research and understands not everyone is passionate about Mayflies.

I find my mentor to be readily available to help me when I ask. She is very knowledgeable and knows how to assist me. I feel like I am an important person to my mentor. She wants me to succeed and supports me in every way.

My faculty mentor is very level headed and has a good temperament, and I trust that he is here to help me. I think he does a phenomenal job explaining why and how we do things. He explains things in a way that helps me retain the information. He gives good guidance and recommendations, and he is easy to get a hold of and reach. His lab challenges me and pushes me out of my comfort zone.

So far my faculty mentor has helped me so much to understand the background information I need to succeed on my research project. My mentor has also helped me to understand the opportunities in their field and explore my interests.

Working with my faculty mentor has been a great learning experience. I feel safe and comfortable to ask questions. There are clear instructions for what I need to do. I've gained confidence in my self and my work from having my mentors support.

My faculty member is very kind, caring, and compassionate. I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to learn from someone like my faculty mentor. They have given advice when needed, leant a helping hand when necessary, and worked hard to ensure I have the best experience possible. I would highly recommend my faculty member.

I love working with my mentor. They are kind hearted and will show me the way when I am in trouble. I look up to my mentor is a multitude of ways and I am having a great time here at UVU because of my mentor.
The faculty mentor I'm working with has always done their best to ensure my success in every way they can.

My faculty mentor has been encouraging and so supportive. She is not afraid to admit if there is something she does not know but will engage in research with me until we find the answer. She shows respect for me as I do for her. My faculty mentor shows real excitement and enthusiasm when working with me. I feel confident I will succeed with her help.

My experience with my faculty mentor has been wonderful. They have super patient with me and are always willing to explain something until I understand the concept. They share the same excitement I have surrounding my research and their passion also engages me further. I feel comfortable asking questions and I love the atmosphere in the lab! I know I will succeed with this mentor and that I made the right choice.

My faculty mentor has helped me so much in the short time I have been working with them. They have taken an interest in what I am hoping to achieve academically and in my career. They make sure I understand what I am doing in every aspect of my project. They constantly connect me to the resources I need so that I can be successful. I know that I can go to my faculty mentor any time I have a question about my project or when I need advice when it comes to my academic and career path.

My faculty mentor, makes themselves very available, by letting the lab members know when they will be around, incase anyone needs any help. My group members don’t utilize our faculty mentor as much as I would like, since there are some very experienced people in my group. However, my faculty mentor teaches and explains thing much better and more thoroughly than the experienced lab members in my group. While I like that my group is independent, I would also like to work more with my faculty mentor. I feel more confident in knowing what I’m doing, when I have worked with my faculty mentor.
Faculty member always explains directions and expectations. they are great at explaining things in detail and explaining why we are doing what we are doing.

The faculty mentor has been understanding. With the year being pretty crazy from covid, I do wish there was more interaction like monthly meetings or something to help me stay in the loop. I feel like if I don't ask what to work on, it won't happen. I know they have a lot going on, but it would be nice to hear from them more often rather than when I have a question and then no additional follow-up, how it went etc. Idk, I think covid has just put additional pressure on everyone, but overall my faculty mentor is great.

The faculty mentor I work with really cares about his/her students success. Their main motive is not to further their own research or career, but rather to help the students have a tremendous experience in their lab. This helps me as a student feel much more comfortable working with the member and makes me not be afraid to make a mistakes. This atmosphere in the lab has led me to have tremendous learning opportunities that I don't think I would have gotten else where.
The faculty mentor is very easy to work with, and is helpful with my research.
Working with Faculty mentor has been awesome so far!
I have loved every second of working with my mentor. Every task that they have given to me has made it seem like htey trust me and want to push me even further.

working with my faculty mentor has been the best part of my collage career. They have supported me not only in my research but also in being a friend and someone I can reach out to for advise about classes and preparing for grad school. They have gone above and beyond for me like helping me prepare essays for internships, as well as, writing me letter of reconmendation even on the day I may need them. Through the S-Stem I feel like I have been given a look behind the curtain, i've been able to see what my professors and mentors do for their students and I am amazed at the amount of time and effort they put towards each of their students.
It has been a wonderful experience and I’ve learned a lot.

My faculty mentor has been super approachable and is always ready to help me and make time for me. I have felt very comfortable in his lab and working in this group has been a very cool experience. My mentor has given me all the resources I’ve asked for to succeed and I have nothing but good things to say so far.

My faculty mentor has done a wonderful job of creating an environment where I feel comfortable to ask any question I have. I also know that when I have a question about a portion of the research she will find multiple ways of explaining it until I completely understand. This year has been hard because my faculty mentor has been very busy and we haven't been able to get into the lab as much as I would have liked; however, I do understand that COVID is the biggest reason for this.
My experience has been good. My mentor has allowed me to see that certain goals I once had are no longer my goals.

The faculty mentor I'm working with likes to push people past their comfort levels in order to help them overcome the intimidation of difficult subjects to develop useful, marketable skills. This is a very good thing because it helps students reduce personal bias and accomplish more. Students are expected to try their best and ask for help when needed. My mentor wouldn't let any of their students fail if they could help it. They are very responsive and helpful.

My faculty mentor shows confidence in my abilities and challenges me to learn and progress. I receive support and encouragement from my faculty mentor. I have learned a great deal already and I know my faculty mentor has much more to teach me. I am so grateful for this opportunity.
My faculty mentor is so kind, sweet, and understanding. She is the epitome of the scientist I want to be one day.

My faculty mentor has been amazing! They are someone who serves as a huge role model for me and helps me all the potential I hold. I always feel comfortable asking questions and it has been a great learning environment for me. I have learned so much about the scientific method and the process of experimental design through this mentor!
My faculty member has been very understanding and respectful of my decision to not come to lab because of covid. Honestly I don't have much to go on from this semester

My faculty mentor has been great to work with. I feel like we are able to communicate very well and if I have any question my faculty mentor is able to answer them professionally while being very respectful. We get along very well and I enjoy working with them. I know that through their guidance I am able to succeed in my research.

The faculty member that I work with is very understanding and takes the time to help me learn at a pace that is realistic. The faculty member is always putting in extra time to make sure the our goals are obtained.

Working with Dr. gas dick has been a wonderful experience not only has she been understanding and always available to me she is opened up a mini doors for me which I do not know existed in her specialty which is virology I have enjoyed working at her lab and alongside her over this past semester

My time with my faculty mentor has been really positive. They have been very supportive and patient with me throughout this semester. I especially appreciate the patience they showed me. I know that it must be difficult to slow down a study for students who are learning so I appreciate how much patience they have shown me.
My faculty mentor has been great to work with. They are always there for me when I need and they respond to my emails within a day. They are helping become a better scientist all together.
My faculty mentors are awesome and have made me feel accepted in the biology world.

The faculty member has been very helpful in all stages of research. They are the perfect amount of "hands on" where we are still able to make mistakes and learn from them, knowing the faculty mentor will always be there to help us.

My faculty mentor tries their best to work with me, but it is often difficult to meet with them, and I don't get as much help as I need because they are so busy. I am having trouble progressing in my research because my faculty mentor is unable to offer help most of the time. When I am able to get help from my mentor, it is good help.

My Mentor had made my experience very enjoyable, educational, and extremely helpful in my career pursuit as well as keeping it reared to his professional specialty. I have enjoyed the dynamic in my lab with other mentees and with the lab group as a whole with my mentor. I have worked hard and my mentor has kept me accountable as well as help me stay focused with things outside of class.

My faculty mentor can be a little intimidating because of how smart and capable they are, but I feel that they are always there to make sure I understand what we are doing. Sometimes I believe that they misjudge my abilities or do not prep me ahead of time for what we will be working on, but in the moment they explain things well and are there if I have questions. They are also very understanding of my schedule and are willing to work around it.
In past semesters I had more attention from my faculty mentor and I felt like I accomplished more. This semester my faculty mentor had too many students and I felt a bit neglected.
Quick to respond, quick to correct. It is fair and very apprenticed. If something is wrong it can be checked.

The faculty mentor that I'm studying with likes to make sure that I see the big picture of any plans before I become involved with a project. This helps me to understand the importance of the intermediate steps, allowing me to piece together how a research project comes together. Any questions I may have are answered quickly, often with resources for further information.

While it has been a little chaotic every since COVID hit, my faculty member has not once waivered on their patience and attitude towards the sciences. I feel I can really understand what they teach, more so now than ever before.
My faculty mentor is the kindest person that I have ever met. She is so understanding and kind. My professional goals are at the top of her priority list, and she makes me feel valued as a person.

My experience with my faculty mentor has been nothing but positive. They have been there for me whenever I needed help and never hesitated to put in the extra work to make sure that I am always at my best.
My mentor is amazing and has proven time and time again how much they want me to succeed in what I do.

The mentor that I work with is very understanding, and helpful. It has been a great experience and my mentor always makes extra time in their schedule for my research. Generally we will do research 1-2 times a week.

Covid has seriously limited what would have been able to be performed in the lab. Being the person they are, my faculty member has taken steps to avoid any possible transmission. At the same time, I am only now getting to the point of completion.
The faculty mentor I work with has shown to be a great role model and I am glad to be being taught by them.

My faculty mentor is very supportive and encouraging to me and my team as we work on our projects. I feel the mentor goes above and beyond to help me be successful, while still allowing us to be very autonomous in our research.

My mentor is one of the kindest and most understanding people that I have met. They help me in all aspects, including research and life. They are the perfect support system that I need to be successful in my educational career.

My faculty mentor has been a very helpful person with me during this process. He is patient with me and helps me when I need help. The thing I like most is that he isn't every hovering over me to get my project done. Instead he allows me to have autonomy and make my own decisions. I couldn't have asked for a better mentor.

My faculty mentor has been very encouraging through my research project. My mentor has challenged me to do things I am unfamiliar with in order to expand my abilities and skills. My mentor has been good to always respond to my questions and concerns right away. My mentor helps me improve in areas I struggle with. Overall it has been a good and positive experience working with my faculty mentor.
He is kinda and understanding. 10/10 would recommend

I have really enjoyed working "faculty mentor" it has been a great experience. I feel that I am treated with respect and that "faculty mentor" is willing to give me as much time and knowledge as I am willing to take. I don't feel like I am pushed or forced to do things it is what I want to make it and I feel that is a valuable thing to have in a mentor.

I have thoroughly enjoyed working with my faculty mentor. I have learned so much about doing research and about myself as a research student. I don't feel dumb asking questions and I feel really comfortable approaching my mentor with any concerns or problems that I come across. 
My mentor treats all students in our lab the same and strives to do his best to assist his research students in any way possible. I couldn't imagine being in any other lab during my undergrad.

My faculty mentor has historically been thoughtful when delegating and overseeing tasks. If there is ever uncertainty on the project, my mentor has been helpful in providing advice and resources to increase my understanding.

My faculty member has been incredibly patient and helpful in working with me. I can imagine it's been frustrating for her to repeatedly teach me about her life's work, but she has never made me feel stupid or silly for asking questions. She's a phenomenal teacher and a wonderful mentor.

Working with my faculty mentor has been the highlight of my undergraduate thus far. They have been supportive helping me work not only in my project but in my academic work as well. They have supported me through burnout and and failure and are the kind of person I would to be like in my future profession.
The research with my faculty mentor has boosted my confidence in the sciences a lot.  Without them or this program, I don't think I would still be pursuing a degree.

My mentor has been more then anything I could’ve hoped for. They care about me as a person, as a student and my success here at UVU and later on in life. They are so patient and understanding when I make mistakes. What I love is that they let me make my own mistakes and be independent but is always there for when I need/want help. They are supportive and encouraging when I’m struggling or didn’t get the results I wanted and care more about what I learned out of it more then anything.

I have greatly enjoyed working with my mentor. The relationship has only progressed over the past semesters and I feel confident and proud of the work that has been done. I feel I would have not been able to achieve any of the goals I have reached without the aide and patience of my mentor and I am very pleased with the decision and agreement we made at the beginning of the program. I think that my lab mates will agree that my mentor has dedicated a considerable amount of time and resources to ensure our success and support and I couldn't be more grateful.

My faculty mentor has been warm and inviting. I really appreciate all the time and guidance they have given to help me succeed in my research. They have been checking in frequently yet also allowing me to do my own work independently. I feel supported and encouraged in my endeavors.

My faculty mentor has been great to work with. They constantly check up on my research and are very supportive. If I need any help at all they are there to help me in anything I need. They have a very positive attitude and expect the most out of me. I have had a great experience working with her.

I strongly feel that my faculty mentor has not only guided me in my current success in the scientific field but it has actually accelerated me past where I thought it would be at my current state in research whereas most people of my status that being a junior at Utah valley university would just now be learning to pipette in some of their 3000 level classes the secondary to my faculty mentor I have far surpassed that and I'm actually presenting my research at international conferences at this point.

Our time together has been brief and things move a bit slow-paced, but it works well with my schedule and I'm grateful to at least just be working towards something even if it isn't huge or extravagant.

My faculty mentor has been such a pleasure to work with. He is fantastic. Always willing to help in any way that he can. Is relatable in every way. Funny and makes science a pleasure to be involved with.
My faculty mentor is awesome. They are very understanding about where I am on my science journey and they're okay with me making mistakes. I’m very happy with my relationship with them.
It has been a great experience where I have learned a lot about who I am as a scientist.

MY faculty member is the kindest person that I know. They believe that this is my project, and it can go any way that I want it to go. They care about me as a person, and they care for my success. Ultimately, researching as an undergrad is interesting because the goal isn't for you to stay here. My faculty mentor knows this and will provide every opportunity for me to move on to my next steps for my career.

My mentor is good to work with when they have time, and aren't being rushed by other duties. However, a lot of the time my faculty mentors schedule doesn't line up with mine and it's pretty difficult to get into the lab and work with them on the research.
He is very understanding and overall I would highly recommend!
He has been very kind and understanding. Not only does he understand when I need to take a break or anything like that but he also knows me personally. I really appreciate it.
it has been great
It has been great so far, I have learned a lot and have had fun.

I definitely respect my faculty mentor and have learned a lot about starting a research project. My faculty mentor is incredibly thorough and passionate about their work. They provide structure and timelines without being too overbearing. While they are very accommodating and nice, sometimes I feel they're too nice (if that makes sense). I worry sometimes about hurting their feelings. Sometimes I feel they're overtly cautious and a little finicky. And while they're always very patient and understanding with me, they tend to extend less patience towards themselves and seem to be a bit perfectionistic. However, I do want to end all of this with the assurance that they're wonderful at their job and have been very supportive. I think most of my other feedback just comes from a small number of personality differences.

My working experience has been one of them, telling me what needs to get done and finding a way to do it. I am not sure I have ever worked in the lab with my mentor one-on-one with my project, but we are both often there, and they are good at answering questions when I have them. I'm not sure if it's the imposter syndrome or if they think I am better than I am, but I feel like they trust me in the lab even when I may not trust myself.

My faculty mentor has done a great job at pointing me in the right direction. I now feel more independent with my research due to their encouragement. At first my faculty mentor helped me learn the importance and processes of my research project, through their help I am now able to perform my research more independently and don't require as much help.

My faculty mentor has a lot of knowledge that is super helpful to steer me in the next step of my project. Our lab gets meaningful professional development during our weekly check-ins which allows us to stay on track and bring up any smaller concerns, or to schedule a longer appointment. I deeply appreciate their experience and expertise as well as their willingness to meet with us. I am; however, disappointed and frustrated with their reaction to a concern/conflict between us and do not feel respected or heard. I feel that I am currently being managed vs. mentored, and this has fostered significant stress and some resentment. Interpersonal conflict can often occur as part of academia and professional settings so I'm trying to use this as a learning opportunity despite the disappointment. We have had several conversations and my attempts to find an acceptable compromise have not been successful, so I think we may need to agree to disagree and find a way to move forward as a team regardless.

My mentor has worked very hard to accommodate all the things happening in my life at the moment. My mentor always makes me feel supported but also holds me accountable. It has been great working with them and we continue to achieve goals that we both wanted to achieve before concluding my time at UVU. My mentor works very hard yet always makes time not only for me but for my lab mates and does a great job of unifying the lab and keeping us in touch/finding each other help when we need it.

I've thoroughly enjoyed my work with my lab mentor! They're very knowledgeable but honest when they, themselves, are unsure of something. They're patient, passionate, and just as driven as I am to conduct worthwhile research.

My faculty mentor is incredibly understanding and supportive. There have been times in which I have been incredibly nervous when I have fallen short of my goals, but my mentor has always been kind and helpful when I need it.
It has been a great experience I feel like they care about me and my future

My faculty mentor has been wonderful. They're not perfect but they're very helpful and patient as I've come to understand my project and its scientific background. Above all else, I feel as though I can come to my mentor with anything and feel respected, heard, and satisfied with the response. I'm very grateful for the professional but close relationship that I've developed with my mentor.

My experience with my faculty mentor has been a very positive one. I have only been in the SSTEM program for two semesters and with my group for one, so I can only talk about a relatively small time frame. 
So far I have felt quite anxious during some of it, but that is far more related to a lack of confidence in my own abilities than because of my mentor. My faculty mentor is demanding of their students, but this is something I actually like. My mentor expects us to learn useful and relevant skills, but directly involves themselves in teaching those skills. So it is a challenge, but one that feels very worthwhile and relevant to my future.

My faculty mentor is AMAZING. Seriously he is so kind and understanding but also firm and informative. He inspires me to grow and ask questions. I really look up to him and cant wait to continue to pick his brain and ask questions.

My mentor is great but I feel as if often my feelings are not understood or taken into account. He also does not communicate well or explain what is actually going on. Everyone in my lab is clueless on what is happening and often we are not allowed to do our own research - like he does everything and we just look at it. No one has ever been in the lab on their own working on their project.

I truly regret picking my mentor to work with. They are great at what they do, but they just have way to many students that they are trying to work with, and it leaves me with literally no help for weeks on end when I reach out to them. I've ended up going to other professors to get help with things that my mentor should be helping me with, which isn't the worst thing but it is very annoying that I can ask for help and be left without help for weeks at a time. My mentor's schedule also just doesn't work with mine at all, leaving me doing things entirely on my own as well. I feel like the prioritize other students that are working on projects that they are more interested in and leaving me on the back burner.

Working with this faculty mentor is always a great experience. I feel welcomed into their lab and feel like questions are invited, I never feel dumb or silly for asking questions. They do everything they can do be available to me when I need assistance

My faculty mentor is the kindest person that I know. They are aware of me, and they want me to succeed in what I want to achieve. They definitely push me a little more towards their field, but they respect all of my decisions. I feel like they help me become the best scientist that I can be. I could not achieve what I have had it not been due to me working with the professor that I am.
I has been a great journey so far. This is the first semester I work with them. I like how understanding and how supportive they are not only with academics but with my personal life as well
The time with my faculty mentor has been a great help and shown me where I want to go in the future.

There have been some things that my faculty mentor and I have not seen eye to eye on and it has negatively affected my motivation with the research. I did not make much progress this semester. We both decided to take a step back on my project for a short time and I have been focusing on my classes as they get more intense. I am looking forward to getting back to it again; hopefully soon.

My experience with my mentor has been amazing. In just 1 semester I've been able to learn and develop skills relating to culturing, lab work, aseptic technique, and most importantly professional communication. I feel respected when I talk about anything relating to my project, like my mentor sees me as a fellow scientist rather than just a student. I feel like that connection has allowed me to develop a "voice" as a scientist, and has really helped with some of the imposter syndrome I was experiencing before starting. Alongside that, when I am wrong or my ideas aren't working, I don't feel like I am being judged or that I did something critically wrong. The idea was incorrect or something didn't work, that means we can learn from it!

My experience with the Faculty mentor this spring semester of 2023 has been truly amazing I feel honored to have worked with my faculty member they have made me feel super comfortable with the lab setting and have taught me a lot of lab methods and techniques that I feel are very valuable and as a growing scientist.

My mentor has been extremely easy to get along with. I feel like an equal and that I can make suggestions, ask questions, and much more without feeling inadequate or stupid. I feel like my mentor trusts my skill set and is willing to teach me skills that I don’t have and that I want to have. It’s been a pleasure.

Working with my faculty mentor has been better than anticipated and I appreciate what they do to help me stay focused. They have gone above and beyond to ensure I am well, stress free, and on track with the research. Although, in part it is my responsibility, I feel seen, heard,  important, and like a valuable student to this mentor. Without them I would not have gotten through with the semester.

My faculty member has been incredibly compassionate and is willing to be flexible with my busy school/work schedule while also helping me maintain a reasonable timeline for getting research work done.
I have a few mentors here a UVU but the two that I am working with on my project are both great and very helpful!  They are both understanding and have helped me improve my skills and knowledge.

I had an amazing faculty mentor I feel like they were willing to help me as much as was need and that they tried to make time for me if it was needed. Perhaps the most important thing that they did was show me how science and research doesn't have to be done on a lab bench for hours on end. It can be completed out in the field and that not every scientist wears a lab coat 24/7.

I had a great experience working with my faculty mentor. They were very supportive of me and gave me the space when necessary to complete my research. If I ever needed help or support my faculty mentor was always there for me.
I have been learning a lot, but I have been making mistakes and it is stressful at times. My faculty mentor is very helpful
He’s amazing. Could not have asked for a better mentor.
I have really enjoyed my faculty mentor and feel that I have learned a lot. I feel that my research experience so far has been great. I like the organized approach of my mentor.

Working with my faculty member has been a success so far. They have taught me how to think more like a scientist and figure out problems that get in our path. I've enjoyed working with them because they are respectful and considerate and they are really here to help me learn.

My experience with my faculty member as of this year it's been quite incredible. As i continue to do my research here at utah valley university I might have given the grand opportunity to be able to mentor a few students in two the idea of scientific research period I mentor has been nothing less of extremely supportive of getting especially minority students tune bark upon this road. He is a true credit to the university.

My faculty mentor really pushed me this semester, and it was an excellent thing for me. I wish there would have been more of this earlier in my research career. I was very motivated early on but became burnt out, but I was glad they pushed me at the end of this semester.
My faculty mentor is very open to help and will find ways to help student's above what is asked of them. I am pushed to learn and have clear goals to follow.
My faculty mentor has been amazing. They not only have helped my in academic matters, but I also feel very supported with personal matters: Decisions about my future and work-life balance.

I think this is my second time taking this survey, but my experience with my faculty mentor has been very enriching. They are always willing to help and supporting me not only in academics, but also other aspects of my life. I feel very grateful and lucky to have this opportunity and I believe I am taking good advantage of it.

Working with my faculty mentor has undoubtedly been one of the most transformative and rewarding experiences of my college career. From the outset, their dedication to fostering my intellectual and personal growth has been nothing short of inspiring.

The guidance and support provided by my mentor have been instrumental in shaping my academic journey. Their wealth of knowledge, coupled with a genuine passion for teaching, has not only deepened my understanding of the subject matter but has also ignited a profound curiosity within me. Through insightful discussions, challenging assignments, and constructive feedback, my mentor has cultivated an environment that encourages critical thinking and academic excellence.

Beyond academics, my mentor has played a pivotal role in my personal development. Their mentorship extends beyond the classroom, offering valuable insights into the nuances of my chosen field and providing guidance on navigating the professional landscape. The mentorship relationship has been characterized by open communication, trust, and a shared commitment to my success.

The impact of this mentorship extends far beyond my college years. The skills and perspectives I've gained under their guidance have equipped me with a solid foundation for future endeavors. The road to excellence, which my mentor has paved, serves as a guiding light as I embark on new challenges and opportunities.

In essence, my faculty mentor has not only been an educator but also a mentor in the truest sense—someone who invests not just in my academic success but also in my overall growth and development. I am profoundly grateful for the invaluable lessons, unwavering support, and the inspiration to strive for excellence that my mentor has provided. This experience has undoubtedly left an indelible mark on my college journey and will continue to influence my pursuits in the years to come.

My faculty mentor has been a wonderful influence on my research pursuits. They've made me feel very comfortable asking seemingly dumb questions and they work hard to ensure that I have the resources I need to complete my project.

The faculty mentor I work with has been an amazing source for support and guidance as I work through my project. They have given me brilliant ideas and supported me through the tough failures. They have also been working extensively with me to get into a PhD program that I will enjoy and allow me to work in the field that I know and care the most about. They have been the best mentor I could have asked for and I genuinely feel like I have a legitimate chance to get into my dream career with their guidance and connections.

Working with My faculty mentor has been a very enjoyable and educational experience. I have learned a lot through working with them, not only specific to our research, but things that are applicable to the rest of my academic career

My faculty mentor is an amazing person and helps me out a ton. Sometimes, I am not sure what is expected from me. Sometimes I am not quite sure what is going on with a specific project or in the lab and when asked my mentor mostly shrugs off the question.

Working with my faculty mentor has been a fantastic journey. Although the progress in our research has been somewhat slow, it’s primarily due to the numerous exciting projects we’re engaged in. My faculty mentor has been incredibly supportive, not only within our research scope but also in my personal interests that lie outside our immediate work. This support has extended to providing me opportunities to mentor my peers, which has been an enriching experience. Most importantly, my faculty mentor has played a crucial role in bolstering my confidence in conducting research and has always made time to address any insecurities I might have. This nurturing environment has allowed me to grow both academically and personally.

I switched faculty members, and feel much more confident working with the new mentor. I feel like my previous mentor didn't respect me as a person, and wasn't putting any effort into working with me or my project. I wish I would have switched sooner.

Working alongside my faculty mentor has been an overall amazing experience, They have made me feel more comfortable in a lab setting and have helped me improve my self-efficacy and STEM identity, I personally adore them, and is overall very grateul to be able to work with them.
It has been great working with my faculty member.

My faculty mentor has been nothing short of respectful, supportive, and cooperative. They have been incredibly helpful, not only in completing our research but also in encouraging me outside of academics. They have fostered a welcoming environment, and I've felt comfortable being honest, even if what I have to share maybe isn't what my mentor wants to hear. However, they have always been supportive and we've been able to communicate effectively and find something that works. They have been a phenomenal mentor.

Working with my faculty mentor has been an amazing experience. They have been so understanding and available to me. They are a person that I can just have conversations with which makes it easier to do the lab work they ask of me.

My experience working with my faculty mentor has been great. My faculty mentor expects a lot, but none of it feels meaningless or arbitrary. My mentor has guided me through many steps of research that I don't know where I would have even begun, and there are even more coming next semester. I know my mentor has sacrificed significant amounts of their time to help me work on my research and I greatly appreciate that. I don't know that many other people would be this dedicated to their students. I must admit I'm even a little intimidated by my mentor, but that's because they are someone who I know genuinely cares and therefore I know the things they expect are important. That is far more intimidating than faculty who are intimidating in the usual way.

I am so happy that I am in this program. It helps immensely to have someone I can reach out to with questions not just about research, but also career paths, the relevance of different classes to different goals, programs, and other opportunities, etc. These are not intuitive or obvious things.

Working with my faculty mentor excites, motivates, and inspires me to continue research. For a minute, at the start of the Fall 2023 semester I wasn't sure if i'd be able to continue and decided to switch mentors and labs all together. Where I was at didn't feel right and attending the 2023 S-STEM conference helped me make the choice to find better fit. In the end, my current faculty mentor supports me in working with others on a project and feeling comfortable in the lab, like I fit in.

The faculty member I have been working with during my undergraduate STEM-scholar experience, has been vital to my academic and career path. I learned skills during research as an undergraduate that I wouldn’t have gained otherwise. My mentor has been extremely understanding, positive, and clear in his expectations. I really can over state how influential my mentor has been.
My faculty mentor has been very helpful. If I have questions they are happy to answer. We meet at least once a week, and they are very helpful in keeping me accountable.

It has been both challenging and rewarding to work with my faculty mentor. I am glad that I have had the opportunity to be in the program and feel that my experience has helped me make connections and taught me things that I may not have been able to otherwise. Difficult and stressful at times, but well worth it.
I feel my mentor is a great support for me. They are very helpful and are always willing to guide me regardless of the path I am choosing

Working with me faculty mentor has been absolutely fantastic. I have been able to take charge and ownership of my project and develop it into something amazing. Their support has been amazing throughout my time with them and I feel like I am learning the skills that will help me become a good scientist. I have always been treated like an equal and my project treated as a priority. I have been given amazing opportunities by my faculty mentor, including poster presentations, networking, and outreach to name a few. Working in the lab almost never feels like a chore and I genuinely enjoy working and developing my project into publication ready material.

Working with my faculty mentor over the past couple years has been a great experience. I have learned a lot from them, they have become a great mentor for me and I feel comfortable coming to them with any questions/concerns I have.
I've had an amazing experience doing research with my mentor. They have been very supportive of my career goals, I couldn't be happier with my decision to join their lab.
My faculty mentor is fantastic, however, sometimes no one is quite sure what is going on in the lab. We also all are kind of scared to mess up because of the large consequences associated with it.

My faculty mentor has entrusted me to work with other lab members and through these collaborations I have learned a lot. There was a set expectation to participate and be a good team member, outside of that I was impressed with how things managed to get done through team work. Working with my faculty mentor was minimal but just the right amount to feel supported.

Working with my faculty mentor has been an experience I am very grateful to have. I have learned many useful lab techniques and feel confident conducting experiments working with microbes. My experience working with my faculty mentor has helped my self-efficacy as a science student and as a scientist within the community.

My faculty mentor has been just that – a mentor, and a fabulous one at that. They have provided both structure and appropriate space for me to do things on my own, but they are always there to ask any questions and provide help. They are truly an expert in their field, and I hope to know my subject as well as they know theirs.
My faculty member has been great it helping me through school.

This semester I have been working with my faculty mentor to finish the data analysis of my project and hopefully try to publish. We have been collaborating with other students on this project during the semester, which has been a big help as well. 
Early in the semester my mentor suggested I apply for REU internships for the summer. They were a great help in my applications, and I got exactly the internship I wanted (though I applied to many others). 
During the semester I went to the UCUR and NCUR conferences to present the project, and my mentor was a great help in reviewing the poster and helping me plan. They were especially helpful in planning the trip to California to attend NCUR.
I have not been as proactive as I could have been in keeping up with my mentor this semester. But that is my own fault and nothing to do with them.

I have enjoyed working with my faculty mentor. They have been a great support when I need them, but they have also allowed me to work independently when appropriate. I have had success as they have helped me acquire grants. They have also encouraged presentations when possible at scientific conferences, and they are a big supporter of research experiences. My faculty mentor is also very smart and great at answering questions!

Working with my faculty mentor has been a great experience. I have learned so much from them and I feel I have improved in my skills as a scientist. I have felt very supported throughout this experience.
Working with my mentor has been excellent and has led me to numerous opportunities I would otherwise never have.

Working with my mentor has been an incredible experience, my mentor has helped guide me and taught me many lab techniques and how to think like a scientist while applying the necessary scientific standards.

Working with my faculty mentor this semester went very well. They were always available when I needed help or clarification. Although I often feel unsure of myself when doing complicated procedures, I feel like I can trust my mentor to help me get past difficulties. I feel that I am becoming more confident as a scientist, in large part thanks to them.

Working with my faculty mentor has been an amazing experience and has not only helped me develop myself academically but also personally and professionally. They are always focused on helping me as a student and person, which has greatly helped me develop and make my project become something I am legitimately proud of. I could not have asked for a better mentor!

My faculty mentor has provided several opportunities for growth and improvement within the laboratory. Whenever I have questions this individual answers them in a kind and respectable way to help me understand. I feel the relationship with this person has grown over the year and  I am confident in my success working with them. Although, there have been some set backs in the project, I am comfortable speaking up and working out a solution with them and the rest of the team.

I worked to do effective research with my faculty mentor, who let me work independently as much as I could but also was there to boost me and help me get on the right track. They were a great balance of letting me figure it out on my own, while also stepping in and helping when appropriate.

Working with my faculty mentor has been an amazing experience and shaped who I am both as a person and as a scientist. We have made amazing progress on this project together, and I am very happy with what we have accomplished. Working with my faculty mentor has helped me learn how to ask interesting questions, find methods to answer those questions, and then understand the results from those methods! The skill that I am learning aren't just how to be a good scientist, but also how to be a better student, a better educator, and a better person, and I feel that words cannot do my faculty mentor justice, they are AMAZING!

Working with my faculty mentor has been great and very beneficial. Although I have a lot going on at home by my faculty mentor was there for me and reminded me that at the end of the day I’m human and things happen in life out of our control. With this individuals help I am able to succeed and push past my limits. I am very grateful to be working with them and am excited to continue my research with them.

Working with my faculty mentor this semester has been great. I very often feel worried about disappointing them. Not because they are harsh or strict or set unreasonable expectations, quite the opposite, but because of lack of confidence in myself. My mentor is always very understanding about problems I have and helps me when I need. I really ought to be asking them for help more often, but in the moment I often don't realize that I should be asking. I trust my faculty mentor and feel that I can count on them.
I’ve enjoyed working with my faculty member and have learned so much about the research as well as their work ethic

I worked in a lab where I was expected to be accountable to my faculty mentor, and set goals for doing my research project. This was helpful in keeping me on track, and get meaningful experiences in research.
